required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of the Safety, Effectiveness and Clinical Use of Maviret in Adolescent Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C Virus
clinical_study.official_title: Real World Evidence of the Safety and Clinical Practice Use of Maviret in Adolescents Patients Infected With Chronic Hepatitis C Virus (All Case Survey)

brief_summary.textblock: This study will assess the safety and effectiveness of Maviret (Glecaprevir plus Pibrentasvir (GLE/PIB)) in adolescent participants diagnosed with chronic hepatitis C (CHC) in a real world setting across clinical practice in Japan.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse drug reactions are defined as adverse events of which a causal relationship with Maviret could not be ruled out.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Adverse Drug Reactions (ADRs)
primary_outcome.description: Adverse drug reactions are defined as adverse events of which a causal relationship with Maviret could not be ruled out.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants with Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.description: A serious adverse event (SAE) is an event that results in death, is life-threatening, requires or prolongs hospitalization, results in a congenital anomaly, persistent or significant disability/incapacity or is an important medical event that, based on medical judgement, may jeopardize the participant and may require medical or surgical intervention to prevent any of the outcomes listed above. Treatment-emergent serious adverse events (TESAEs) are defined as any event that began or worsened in severity after the first dose of study drug.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.description: A serious adverse event (SAE) is an event that results in death, is life-threatening, requires or prolongs hospitalization, results in a congenital anomaly, persistent or significant disability/incapacity or is an important medical event that, based on medical judgement, may jeopardize the participant and may require medical or surgical intervention to prevent any of the outcomes listed above. Treatment-emergent serious adverse events (TESAEs) are defined as any event that began or worsened in severity after the first dose of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants achieving Sustained Virologic Response 12 (SVR12)
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as HCV Ribonucleic acid (RNA) not detected 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of participants achieving Sustained Virologic Response (SVR)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At 4, 8, 12 and 24 weeks after last dose of Maviret (up to approximately 36 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: SVR defined as HCV Ribonucleic acid (RNA) < Lower limit of quantification (LLOQ).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with On-Treatment Virologic Failure (Breakthrough)
secondary_outcome.description: On-treatment virologic failure (breakthrough) defined as at least 1 documented HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL followed by HCV RNA ≥ 50 IU/mL during treatment or failure to suppress (each measured on-treatment HCV RNA value ≥ 50 IU/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants with After-Treatment Virologic Failure (Relapse)
secondary_outcome.description: After-treatment virologic failure (relapse) is defined as confirmed HCV RNA ≥ LLOQ between the end of treatment and 24 weeks after the last dose of study drug among participants who completed treatment with HCV RNA levels < LLOQ at the end of treatment.

arm_group.description: Participants receiving glecaprevir plus pibrentasvir (GLE/PIB, other names: Maviret) as routine standard of care for HCV.

study_pop.textblock: Participants aged ≥ 12 to <18 years of age with chronic hepatitis C receiving Maviret in accordance with local label.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Chronic Hepatitis C Virus (HCV) infection treated in daily practice with Maviret
- Enrolled after Maviret treatment begins
- Prior treatment with Maviret
Exclusion Criteria:
- None

overall_contact.last_name: AbbVie GK Clinical Trial Registration Desk
